value.definition: a compound formed in protein metabolism and present in much living tissue. It is involved in the supply of energy for muscular contraction.
a light, thin fabric with a wrinkled surface
value.example: a crÃªpe bandage

value.definition: a thin pancake.
separate into pieces as a result of a blow, shock, or strain
value.example: the rope broke with a loud snap

value.definition: interrupt (a continuity, sequence, or course)
value.example: the new government broke the pattern of growth

value.definition: fail to observe (a law, regulation, or agreement)
value.example: the council says it will prosecute traders who break the law

value.definition: crush the emotional strength, spirit, or resistance of
value.example: the idea was to better the prisoners, not to break them

value.definition: (of the weather) change suddenly, especially after a fine spell
value.example: the weather broke and thunder rumbled through a leaden sky

value.definition: (of news or a scandal) suddenly become public
value.example: since the news broke I've received thousands of wonderful letters

value.definition: (chiefly of an attacking player or team, or of a military force) make a rush or dash in a particular direction
value.example: Mitchell won possession and broke quickly, allowing Hughes to score

value.definition: an interruption of continuity or uniformity
value.example: the magazine has been published without a break since 1950

value.definition: a pause in work or during an activity or event
value.example: I need a break from mental activity

value.definition: a gap or opening
value.example: the track bends left through a break in the hedge

value.definition: an instance of breaking something, or the point where something is broken
value.example: he was stretchered off with a break to the leg

value.definition: a rush or dash in a particular direction, especially by an attacking player or team
value.example: Norwich scored on a rare break with 11 minutes left

value.definition: an opportunity or chance, especially one leading to professional success
value.example: he got his break as an entertainer on a TV music hall show

value.definition: a consecutive series of successful shots, scoring a specified number of points
value.example: a break of 83 put him in front for the first time

value.definition: a bud or shoot sprouting from a stem.
threads of silk, cotton, or other material woven into a decorative band for edging or trimming garments
value.example: fancy braids

value.definition: a length of hair made up of three or more interlaced strands
value.example: her hair curled neatly in blonde braids

value.definition: interlace three or more strands of (hair or other flexible material) to form a length
value.example: their long hair was tightly braided

value.definition: edge or trim (a garment) with braid
value.example: braided red trousers

value.definition: (of a river or stream) flow into shallow interconnected channels divided by deposited earth or alluvium
value.example: a braided river carries an enormous burden of sand and gravel
